issue.title: Introduce feature flag for auto-closing `AutoCloseable` in Jupiter's `ExtensionContext.Store`

type.name: Feature
type.description: A request, idea, or new functionality

repository.name: junit-framework
repository.description: ✅ The programmer-friendly testing framework for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
Currently, only instances of `CloseableResource` that are stored in an `ExtensionContext.Store` are closed automatically when the `ExtensionContext` is closed. However, items stored in the session-/request-level stores only need to implement `AutoCloseable`. To address this confusing difference in behavior, we should introduce a configuration parameter that allows to treat `AutoCloseable` like `CloseableResource` in Jupiter's stores. It should be "on" by default in 5.13.

## Deliverables

- [x] Introduce configuration parameter for enabling auto-closing `AutoCloseable` objects (`true` by default)
- [x] Deprecate `CloseableResource`
- ~Make `CloseableResource` extend `AutoCloseable` so existing implementations would keep working~ Doesn't work because `CloseableResource#close` is allowed to throw `Throwable`, not just `Exception`
- [x] Log warning if an object is ~put into~ encountered while closing the `Store` that implements `CloseableResource` but not `AutoCloseable` (if the feature is on)
- [x] Document migration path for external extensions (implement both `CloseableResource` and `AutoCloseable` should they need to support pre-5.13 versions)

body: I've also opened testcontainers/testcontainers-java#10525 as an enhancement request to update their JUnit extension to implement AutoCloseable as now recommended.

rename.from: JUnit 5.13+ spams warning about Type implements CloseableResource but not AutoCloseable
rename.to: Reduce number of logged warnings for type implementing `CloseableResource` but not `AutoCloseable`

issue.title: Log only once per implementation type for `CloseableResource` types

repository.name: junit-framework
repository.description: ✅ The programmer-friendly testing framework for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
To avoid flooding console output with warnings.

Resolves #4776.
